{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3454570,"name":"graywhaler","username":"graywhaler","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/b9bd4f/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-12-04T14:58:32.981Z","cooked":"

Has anyone tried networking Limelight 3A with a Roborio for use in FRC? Any lessons learned? Programming tips? We have a few and would use them instead of going out and buying additional Limelight 3/3G.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-12-04T14:58:32.981Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":396,"reads":518,"readers_count":517,"score":2143.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":475999,"topic_slug":"using-limelight3a-for-frc","display_username":"graywhaler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26032,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/using-limelight3a-for-frc/475999/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3454994,"name":"Mr. Steele","username":"Omuzder","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/omuzder/{size}/154171_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-05T14:24:02.553Z","cooked":"

I was under the impression they were designed for FTC only. If they work well for FTC that is a game changer! If you do follow through on experimenting with this, I would love to hear more.

Hmmm. The site says its compatible with FTC, FRC, and ROS systems. So some fiddling around may produce some results… but emailing LL and asking how to get network tables out of the 3A would be a good idea.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-12-05T17:35:42.537Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":366,"readers_count":365,"score":118.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":475999,"topic_slug":"using-limelight3a-for-frc","display_username":"graywhaler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":14980,"username":"Zook","name":"Tom","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zook/{size}/252720_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26032,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/using-limelight3a-for-frc/475999/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3455575,"name":"Brandon_Hjelstrom","username":"Brandon_Hjelstrom","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/6a8cbe/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-12-06T02:13:17.012Z","cooked":"

@graywhaler
Documentation will appear for this later, but as long as you set the team number on a 3A, it will auto populate networktables just like any other Limelight!

If you have multiple 3As, you can assign a unique index and hostname to each unit.

You will need to enable port-forwarding in your robot code to access the stream and interface while connected to your robot over WiFi/Ethernet.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-12-20T14:47:32.720Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":225,"readers_count":224,"score":50.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":475999,"topic_slug":"using-limelight3a-for-frc","display_username":"graywhaler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":17110,"username":"Brandon_Hjelstrom","name":"Brandon_Hjelstrom","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/6a8cbe/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26032,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/using-limelight3a-for-frc/475999/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3493616,"name":"Ben Edwards","username":"beedward","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/beedward/{size}/111315_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-27T13:19:14.272Z","cooked":"

Hi Brandon, maybe our programming team has already reached out to you but just in case - We on 6500 have been trying to use a Limelight 3A this year with no success. We set the team number but it’s not populating networktables or connecting through the RIO with port forwarding set up. We’re not sure what we’re doing wrong. There’s another thread here Help with Limelight 3A use for FRC (Network Tables) with details.
Thanks for any help you can give
Ben Edwards, mentor of 6500

Hi @Brandon_Hjelstrom, I also have an email out to Limelight asking about the 3A for the FRC 2025 season. But I’ll ask here as well.

Do you expect that the 2024 image for the 3A will be able to populate the Network Tables for a roborio that is imaged for 2025?

Specifically for us - looking at the tx, ty values of the April tags and not 3D pose outputs.
